name: 2-[(E)-2-(4-Hydroxy-3-methoxyphenyl)vinyl]-6-methoxy-4-methylphenol
Reason: 2-[(E)-2-(4-Hydroxy-3-methoxyphenyl)vinyl]-6-methoxy-4-methylphenol has a melting point that can be predicted by considering its structural components. The basic unit for comparison is 2-propanol, which has a melting point of 100 degrees Celsius. The hydroxyl group in the phenolic moiety increases the melting point due to hydrogen bonding, estimated at +20 degrees Celsius. The methoxy group introduces a slight increase in molecular weight and van der Waals forces, estimated at +5 degrees Celsius. The vinyl group reduces the melting point due to the absence of hydrogen bonding potential, estimated at -10 degrees Celsius. The methyl group adds a slight increase in molecular weight, estimated at +5 degrees Celsius. The 4-hydroxy-3-methoxyphenyl group introduces a significant increase due to the enhancement of the crystalline structure and the increase in molecular weight, estimated at +30 degrees Celsius. The carbonyl group introduces a polar carbonyl interaction, estimated at +20 degrees Celsius.
